column4: any idea why hibernate stopped working in Dapper, it just restarts the system now.
i'm taking about rather than restoring after syuspend, it just restarts
cuz i pretty much stopped all my apps that use networking before i hit hibernate
...oh..wait...would suspend to disk be dependant on the kernal image you were using?
it might be that you need to boot with restore=/dev/foo where /dev/foo is your swap partition, for it to work
and yes, a normal boot will obliterate the session
alrighty then, no real big loss
yeah, I use swsusp a lot
yeah, i think my problem was i didn't specify the kernel i suspended with, because i think my ndiswrapper conflicts with 686
I imagine very Bad Things(TM) will happen if you boot a different kernel than you suspended with and manage to get the session to restore
yeah, i totally forgot i had done that.
